text: behind the mask a taxi driver accused of
raping a 22nd Ellie on Friday night
police say he was driving this car when
the victim hired it using mobile phone
app uber she dozed off and when she woke
up it was parked in a secluded spot in
Parliament
India's Minister for security read out
the government statement the vehicle
used in the crime has been found and
brought to Delhi where it will be
subjected to thorough forensic
examination the accused has been
arrested Delhi's Transport Department
has banned the use of uber services in
the city in a statement before the ban
uber said upon being notified of this
incident our team immediately provided
the authorities with all relevant
details of the driver vehicle and trip
route uber also has a GPS trace and
record of all trips that occur on the
platform
I'll say for women in India when
traveling around the streets of its
cities that's what this incident once
again puts a spotlight on especially
since it happened in the national
capital Delhi a place that has more
policemen than many other parts of the
country some groups protested outside
the headquarters of the Delhi police it
was public anger after the gang rape of
a city student that forced the
government to make tougher laws for
women's safety that was two years ago
here with Alloway BBC news Delhi
